quotes.quote: Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.
quotes.speaker: Daniel Webster

quotes.quote: Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Deuteronomy, 25:4

quotes.quote: The haft of the arrow had been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes. We often give our enemies the means of our own destruction.
quotes.speaker: Aesop

quotes.quote: Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote: So teach us to number our days, so that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Psalms, 90:12

quotes.quote: How happy are those whose walls already rise!
quotes.speaker: Virgil

quotes.quote: The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.
quotes.speaker: J. Paul Getty

quotes.quote: Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, What makest thou?
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Isaiah, 45:9

quotes.quote: He who commands the sea has command of everything.
quotes.speaker: Themistocles

quotes.quote: Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.
quotes.speaker: Japanese Proverb

quotes.quote: Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.
quotes.speaker: Saint Jerome

quotes.quote: He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.
quotes.speaker: John Milton

quotes.quote: Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stand on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.
quotes.speaker: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote:
Better is bread with a happy heart
Than wealth with vexation.
quotes.speaker: Amenemope

quotes.quote: What is drama but life with the dull bits cut out.
quotes.speaker: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.quote: Instrumental or mechanical science is the noblest and, above all others, the most useful.
quotes.speaker: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: My kingdom for a horse!
quotes.speaker: Shakespeare (Richard III)

quotes.quote: Do not wait to strike 'til the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
quotes.speaker: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.
quotes.speaker: Roger Bacon

quotes.quote:
He made an instrument to know
If the moon shine at full or no.
quotes.speaker: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
quotes.speaker: Socrates

quotes.quote: Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England.
quotes.speaker: Malory

quotes.quote: The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is its inefficiency.
quotes.speaker: Eugene McCarthy

quotes.quote: I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving...
quotes.speaker: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Education is the best provision for old age.
quotes.speaker: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...
quotes.speaker: Sri Guru Granth Sahib

quotes.quote: The press is the best instrument for enlightening the mind of man, and improving him as a rational, moral and social being.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.
quotes.speaker: Sri Guru Granth Sahib

quotes.quote: Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote:
John Henry said to his Captain,
'A man ain't nothin' but a man,
And before I'll let your steam drill beat me down,
I'll die with the hammer in my hand.'
quotes.speaker: Anonymous: The Ballad of John Henry, the Steel-Drivin' Man

quotes.quote: Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do.
quotes.speaker: St. Thomas Aquinas

quotes.quote: Their rising all at once was as the sound of thunder heard remote.
quotes.speaker: Milton

quotes.quote: Architecture begins where engineering ends.
quotes.speaker: Walter Gropius

quotes.quote: Joyfully to the breeze royal Odysseus spread his sail, and with his rudder skillfully he steered.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote: Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook and a good digestion.
quotes.speaker: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.
quotes.speaker: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.quote: Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The day when two army corps can annihilate each other in one second, all civilized nations, it is to be hoped, will recoil from war and discharge their troops.
quotes.speaker: Alfred Nobel

quotes.quote: There never was a good knife made of bad steel.
quotes.speaker: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
quotes.speaker: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: It is a newspaper's duty to print the news and raise hell.
quotes.speaker: The Chicago Times

quotes.quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
quotes.speaker: George Santayana

quotes.quote: If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.
quotes.speaker: Lyall Watson

quotes.quote: As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.
quotes.speaker: Christopher Dawson

quotes.quote: Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?
quotes.speaker: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.
quotes.speaker: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.
quotes.speaker: Emily Greene Balch

quotes.quote: Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.
quotes.speaker: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it.
quotes.speaker: Robert E. Lee

quotes.quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.
quotes.speaker: John Dewey

quotes.quote: The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.
quotes.speaker: Townsend Harris

quotes.quote: I once sent a dozen of my friends a telegram saying "flee at once-all is discovered!" They all left town immediately.
quotes.speaker: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: 'Once the rockets are up, who cares where they come down? That's not my department,' says Wernher von Braun.
quotes.speaker: Tom Lehrer

quotes.quote: Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.
quotes.speaker: Trip Hawkins

quotes.quote: Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.
quotes.speaker: Igor Sikorsky

quotes.quote: The speed of communications is wondrous to behold, it is also true that speed does multiply the distribution of information that we know to be untrue.
quotes.speaker: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.
quotes.speaker: Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

quotes.quote: The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.
quotes.speaker: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.
quotes.speaker: William Wordsworth

quotes.quote: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
quotes.speaker: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.
quotes.speaker: Ludwig von Mises

quotes.quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods: lots of rules and no mercy.
quotes.speaker: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: Only within the moment of time represented by the present century has one species, man, acquired significant power to alter the nature of his world.
quotes.speaker: Rachel Carson

quotes.quote: I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds.
quotes.speaker: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quotes.quote:
Everything passes - Robust art
Alone is eternal.
The bust
Survives the city.
quotes.speaker: Theophile Gautier

quotes.quote: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
quotes.speaker: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: A good rule for rocket experimenters to follow is this: always assume that it will explode.
quotes.speaker: Astronautics Magazine, 1937

quotes.quote: Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.
quotes.speaker: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.quote: I think we agree, the past is over.
quotes.speaker: George W. Bush

quotes.quote: The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.
quotes.speaker: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.quote: The night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the armor of light.
quotes.speaker: The Holy Bible: Romans, 13:12

quotes.quote: All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.
quotes.speaker: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: The impact of nanotechnology is expected to exceed the impact that the electronics revolution has had on our lives.
quotes.speaker: Richard Schwartz

quotes.quote: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Every particle of matter is attracted by or gravitates to every other particle of matter with a force inversely proportional to the squares of their distances.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote:
1. A robot may not injure a human being or, through inaction, allow a human being to come to harm.
2. A robot must obey any orders given to it by human beings, except when such orders would conflict with the First Law.
3. A robot must protect its own existence as long as such protection does not conflict with the First or Second Law.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: Now, somehow, in some new way, the sky seemed almost alien.
quotes.speaker: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.quote: Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.
quotes.speaker: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
quotes.speaker: J.B. Priestly

quotes.quote: The Internet is the first thing that humanity has built that humanity doesn't understand, the largest experiment in anarchy that we have ever had.
quotes.speaker: Eric Schmidt
